#text=He was annoyed at school when he had to push it out of the way to see his paper .
#text=So him and his mommy decided to go see the barber .
#text=Brandon loved the barber and his silly jokes and chit chat .
#text=He liked listening to the men talk .
#text=When Brandon got to the barber he lead him to the hair washing sink .
#text=He sat him in the chair that tilted back into the sink and laid back as the barber washed his hair .
#text=The water was just right , Never too hot or cold .
#text=Next they walked over to the hair cutting chair .
#text=Brandon loved it when the barber pumped his chair way up high and he could see himself in the large mirror in front of him .
#text=The barber asked Brandon how he would like his hair cut and mommy told him just how they like it .
#text=Then he wrapped a big cape around Brandon to protect him from hair clippings .
#text=Once his hair was towel dried and combed well .
#text=The barbers chair is a place even for little boys to be still and Brandon knew that .
#text=He watched as his hair fell to the floor .
#text=Soon the barber spun him around in the chair and Brandon saw his new hair cut .
#text=After another comb through and a few more snips of the scissors he was all done .
#text=Brandons mommy paid the barber and tipped him for a job well done .
#text=Brandon was glad for his hair cut .
